meanings.definition: To press or squeeze into small folds or ridges.
meanings.sent1: She was crimping the paper to make a fan.
meanings.sent2: The chef was crimping the edges of the pie crust.
meanings.sent3: The tailor accidentally crimped the fabric too much, creating a unique design.
meanings.sent4: The old book had pages crimped from years of use.
meanings.sent5: The child's hands were busy crimping the playdough into different shapes.

meanings.definition: To secure or hold in place by crimping.
meanings.sent1: He was crimping the wires together to ensure a strong connection.
meanings.sent2: The hairdresser crimped the hairpins to keep the hairstyle intact.
meanings.sent3: The detective crimped the evidence bag carefully to preserve the clues.
meanings.sent4: She crimped the edges of the envelope, sealing it shut.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter crimped the metal sheets together for added stability.

meanings.definition: The act of creating small folds or ridges in something.
meanings.sent1: Her crimping of the ribbon added a decorative touch to the gift.
meanings.sent2: The crimping on the fabric gave it a textured appearance.
meanings.sent3: The crimping on the pastry made it look like a professional bakery product.
meanings.sent4: The crimping on the metal sheet provided extra grip for handling.
meanings.sent5: The crimping on the edge of the paper gave it a neat finish.
